qas.question: Who criticized Microsofts closed platform Windows Store?
What company is Rob Pardo associated with?
What was the main reasoning behind the creation of the Windows Store?

answers.text: responding to the success of both Apple and Google in pursuing the "curated application store approach."

qas.question: Who criticized Microsofts open platform Windows Store?
What company is Rob Pardo unassociated with?

plausible_answers.text: responding to the success of both Apple and Google in pursuing the "curated application store approach."

qas.question: What wasn't the main reasoning behind the creation of the Windows Store?

context: Several notable <a0_0><b5_0>video game developers<b5_0/><a0_0/> criticized Microsoft for making its Windows Store a closed platform subject to its own regulations, as it conflicted with their view of the PC as an open platform. <a1_0><b6_0>Markus "Notch" Persson<b6_0/><a1_0/> (creator of the indie game Minecraft), <a2_0><b7_0>Gabe Newell<b7_0/><a2_0/> (co-founder of Valve Corporation and developer of software distribution platform Steam), and Rob Pardo from <a3_0><b8_0>Activision Blizzard<b8_0/><a3_0/> voiced concern about the closed nature of the Windows Store. However, Tom Warren of The Verge stated that Microsoft's addition of the Store was simply <a4_0><b9_0>responding to the success of both Apple and Google in pursuing the "curated application store approach."
